name: General Knowledge 3 Quiz / Test | General | 15 Questions

questions.text: Man O'War was a great race horse but not much of a sire.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He was one of the top sires.

questions.text: The first Best Actress Academy Award went to Lillian Gish.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It went to Janet Gaynor in 1928.

questions.text: Will Rogers was part Choctaw Indian.
Seoul was chosen as the site of the 1988 summer Olympics.
William Demarest played Fred Mertz on 'I Love Lucy'.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Fred Mertz was played by William Frawley.

questions.text: Iceland became independent of Norway in 1944.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It became independent of Denmark.

questions.text: 'All Quiet On The Western Front' was the first war movie with sound.
questions.explanation:
True.

	That was the 1930 release. It was remade in 1979.

questions.text: Brasilia was declared the capital of Brazil in 1960.
Ian Fleming wrote 'Chitty Chitty Bang Bang'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The movie version released in 1968 was based loosely on the book.

questions.text: Doris Von Kappelhof had the hit song 'Whatever Will Be Will Be'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	That's the real name of Doris Day.

questions.text: 'The William Tell Overture' was the theme song for 'The Lone Ranger'.
'Puppy Love' was a hit song for Bobby Vee.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Paul Anka had the hit in 1960.

questions.text: The United States bought Florida from England.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They bought it from Spain in 1819.

questions.text: 'Lullaby Of Broadway' was a song from the movie 'State Fair'.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The song was written for "The Gold Diggers of 1935". There was also a movie with the same title. It came out in 1951 and starred Doris Day.

questions.text: The distance from the foul line to the headpin in bowling is 70 feet.
